author: mysticryuujin
content: Are there any charts showing the state growth of Medalla for storage? I'm curious what kinda storage would work "long term" (a couple years). Ignoring ETH1 node size of course.

author: superphiz
content: That would be an interesting suggestion for the medalla data challenge.

author: ajsutton
content:
<@372731338031366165> the data you ultimately will need to store to run a validator and query latest state will wind up being quite small and roughly constant sized. You can discard any state before the finalised epoch (teku does this when in prune mode now) and can discard any blocks prior to the week subjectivity period (can’t do this yet because clients don’t yet support syncing from a weak subjectivity snapshot but will need to move that way for security reasons). 

In periods of non finalisation the disk required will grow and states grow gradually as more validators are added over time but it’s pretty stable generally and should be easily under 10Gb.

author: ajsutton
content: If you want access to historical states it will grow about linearly and be in line with stats you’d get from medalla disk usage now.

content: Good to know! Thanks for the info.
